titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York City public property auctions catalogue and advertisement ARC.261
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:15:30 +0000.

did.unittitle: New York City public property auctions catalogue and advertisement

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York (N.Y.). Office of the Comptroller

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Jeremiah Johnson Jr. Co. (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

physdesc.extent: in one folder in one oversize box.

did.abstract: One catalogue published in 1926 by the New York City Compstroller's Office featuring descriptions and photographs of property in all five city boroughs going up for sale at a public auction. Also included is an advertisement released in 1924 by Jeremiah Johnson Jr. Co. Real Estate Auctioneers for 600 property lots in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Flatbush going up for sale at public auction.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); New York City public property auctions catalogue and advertisement, ARC.261, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.
